intro: Doronicum wulfenianum, commonly known as the alpine buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers in the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
